snippet: Industry officials say proposed rules on hydraulic fracturing would significantly limit opportunities for both companies and the upstate New York communities that hope for an economic boom.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo is expected to make decision on whether hydraulic fracturing, already underway in other states, will be allowed in New York; industry officials say proposed rules on hydraulic fracturing would limit any hopes for economic boom in upstate communities, while environmental groups say drilling process, or fracking, poses too high a risk of groundwater contamination and air pollution.
lead_paragraph: Industry officials say proposed rules on hydraulic fracturing would significantly limit opportunities for both companies and the upstate New York communities that hope for an economic boom.

headline.seo: Bans and New Rules Make Gas Drilling’s Future Uncertain in New York
headline.main: Bans and Rules Muddy Prospects for Gas Drilling
headline.print_headline: Bans and Rules Muddying Prospects for Gas Drilling
